data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Either take 9 steps left or take 9 steps backward. The starting point is facing forward. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn around turns the person away from where they are. The answer: Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
First, you take 6 steps, then take 4 steps, then finish your turn and take 10 steps. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can return to 7 steps before moving one step. So, the answer is yes.

The instructions say to turn around, take 5 steps, turn around, take 10 steps, turn around, take 3 steps, turn around, take 5 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn around and take 7 steps to return to the starting point. Turning around and taking 7 steps will give you a 10th of the total steps you will have to go. So, the answer is yes.

One must always face forward to return back to starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.

Take 30 steps -> 6 steps = 90 steps. Take 2 steps -> 5 steps = 6 steps. Take 7 steps -> 7 steps = 35 steps. Take 6 steps -> 3 steps = 15 steps. Thus, the answer is Yes.

The steps are the same except the next step taken is backward and starts at the top left corner of the screen. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

A person facing forward starts by facing forward. If one takes 6 steps backward, they will take 6 steps backward again. The starting point for the person faced forward is facing forward. If one also takes 8 steps right, they will take 8 steps right. The starting point for the person from behind is facing backward. So, the answer is no.

Do the following except the last statement: Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backwards. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. So, the answer is No.

If one always always faces forward, one cannot get back to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

It is a set of instructions that you never need to exit. Taking 7 steps left and 2 steps right would return you back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

Let’ s say that the first step you take is facing forward. First, you take two steps backward, to take up the second step. Next, you take three steps backward, to take up the third step. The fourth step is to take your left away from the starting point by taking three steps backward. Taking 4 steps forward equals 8 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

At one point in time, you need to start all over again. It is physically impossible to return to the same point that you got to. There is no way to go back from a forward position. So, the answer is No.
